question: Question_07
statement:
\textbf{Full-Solution Problem. Justify your answer and show your work.
Full simplification of numerical answers is required unless explicitly
stated otherwise.}

At a distance of 4 kilometres from the launch site, a spectator is
observing a rocket being launched. If the rocket lifts off vertically
and is rising at a speed of 0.7 kilometres/second when it is at an
altitude of 3 kilometres, how fast is the distance between the rocket
and the spectator changing at that instant?
